content:
RNA
Extraction
Denaturing
Agarose
To 1 ml RNA extraction buffer (50 mM Tris pH 7.5,
5mM EDTA, 0.5% SDS) add Proteinase to 150 ug/ml
from a 10 mg/ml stock in H20.
Transfer 5 RNA injected oocytes to disposable 5ml
glass test tube (or whatever else is available). Add
1ml Proteinase solution in extraction buffer.
Homogenize as rapidly as possible with pasteur
pipet (the strategy is to allow the proteinase to
attack the cellular RNase, before it attacks the
RNA). Incubate at room temperature 1/2 hour.
Extract the RNA once with zum equal vol.
phenol/chloroform, once with chloroform. Bring
aqueous fraction to 0.3 Na0Ac pH 5.2, add 2.5 vol.
and precipitate at least 2 hrs.
Pellet RNA in centrifuge. Discard ethanol as
radioactive waste, rinse pellet with 70% 
discard, and dry. Resuspend RNA in 100 ul H20.
Transfer to microcentrifuge tube. Add 100 ul 6M
LiCl, mix, incubate on ice 2 hrs.
Pellet RNA, and you guessed it, discard LiCl, rinse
pellet with 70% discard and dry.
Into a medium size flask measure out sufficient
Agarose for a 25 ml 1.4% gel. Add 16 ml H20, and
RNA Gel: dissolve agarose by heating to a boil. When
dissolved add 5ml 5X MOPS buffer, and let cool.
Tape off the ends of minigel as before, and place
in fume hood. When agarose has cooled to touch,
add 4.1 nd. formaldehyde, and swirl tx> mix.
Immediately after mixing, pour into gel form, and
let harden.
In a clean microcentrifuge tube prepare an RNA
denaturing buffer by mixing together: 20 ul 5X MOPS,
35 ul formaldehyde, and 100 ul formamide.
Resupend RNA in 2.5 ul H20. Add 7.5 ul RNA
denaturing solution,and,incubateaM:55 deg.for 15
min. Cool tube in ice for several seconds then
microfuge for several seconds. Add 2ul sample
loading buffer. 
Remove comb, and tape from minigel, and submerge gel
in 1X MOPS. Load samples in wells. Run gel at 60 
until bromophenol blue (the leading dye) runs to
about the end of the gel. Remove gel and fix
samples by soaking overnight in 10% 10% Acetic
acid, on rotary shaker.
